operational_hours.notes: Tower operational 0600L-2245L (1400-0645 UTC). Airport itself operates continuously. Night operations outside tower hours permitted for equipped aircraft. Class D airspace. Customs pre-clearance available with 24-hour notice.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: No slots required - general aviation operations
slot_requirements.notes: World's busiest general aviation airport (230,000+ operations annually). No formal slot control but traffic management via tower coordination. VFR reporting points (Cal State Northridge, VA Hospital) used for sequencing.

weather_vulnerability.snow_closure_frequency: Rare - minimal winter impact at elevation
weather_vulnerability.seasonal_risk_periods: Summer: occasional thunderstorms; Winter: minimal impact
weather_vulnerability.notes: ILS approaches available on RWY 16R (ILS Y and ILS Z). Operated under favorable Southern California climate. Rare weather delays. Approach minimums approximately 200ft DA for ILS.

runway_details.notes: Secondary runway - suitable for training and smaller aircraft. Staggered threshold design.

runway_specifications.notes: Closely spaced parallel runways with staggered thresholds. Pilots advised to avoid confusion between runways, particularly during intersection takeoffs on RWY 16R/34L.

crew_requirements.notes: Standard FAA commercial pilot qualifications required. CAT I ILS rating mandatory for approaches below 500ft AGL in marginal weather. No special mountain/high-altitude training needed.

handling_complexity.notes: Multiple FBO operators available. Customs user fee required with minimum 24-hour notice. Efficient ground handling for general aviation. IS-BAH accreditation typical for major handlers.

congestion_metrics.airspace_complexity: Medium - Class D under Burbank Class C
congestion_metrics.atc_delays_frequency: Frequent during peak hours due to traffic volume
congestion_metrics.notes: Extremely high density general aviation: 230,000+ operations annually. Peak delays during summer weekdays. Separation challenges due to closely spaced runways. Efficient tower management mitigates congestion relative to volume.

permits_and_clearances.notes: US general aviation airport - no landing permits required. Standard Class D airspace procedures. Continuous tower presence simplifies traffic coordination.

noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: High - urban/suburban location in San Fernando Valley
noise_restrictions.notes: Subject to Los Angeles noise abatement program. Quarterly noise reports published. High-power engine run-ups restricted in certain areas and times. Noise monitoring active.

infrastructure_reliability.historical_closure_incidents: No significant closures in recent years
infrastructure_reliability.notes: Modern facility with redundant systems. Continuous tower operations ensure infrastructure monitoring. Well-funded by LAWA operational model.

security_requirements.passenger_background_check_required: Standard FAA/DHS requirements for international flights
security_requirements.notes: General aviation security commensurate with operation type. CBP pre-clearance reduces processing delays for international operations.

seasonal_factors.holiday_peak_dates: Christmas/New Year, Thanksgiving, summer school breaks
seasonal_factors.notes: Relatively stable year-round weather. Summer thunderstorms primarily afternoon convection. Tourist/vacation patterns drive demand spikes. Business aviation dominates weekday traffic.

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Hollywood Burbank (BUR) primary alternate - 8 miles NE with modern terminal. LAX major international hub 18 miles SW. Multiple regional GA airports provide options. Surface transport readily available throughout LA basin.

payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Payment on delivery or account basis standard
payment_and_fees.notes: Standard US general aviation fees. Landing fees minimal ($25-75 typical). Parking charges variable by FBO. Customs fees apply (typically $50-200 per operation). Wire transfer and credit card accepted.

airports.name: Dubai Al Maktoum International Airport (Dubai World Central)

operational_hours.notes: 24/7 operations - continuous runway availability. Designed to accommodate round-the-clock cargo and passenger traffic. Fire category 9 equipment maintains standards during night operations.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: Generally available except peak cargo periods
slot_requirements.peak_congestion_times: Night hours (2200-0600 UTC) peak cargo window
slot_requirements.notes: Slot-coordinated airport - advance booking required. IATA Level 2 coordination. Significant cargo focus drives peak traffic patterns. Commercial passengers increasing post-expansion.

weather_vulnerability.wind_limitations: Dust storms primary weather threat - can reduce visibility to 500m
weather_vulnerability.seasonal_risk_periods: March-May and September-November: dust storm season peaks; Summer: extreme heat (45째C+)
weather_vulnerability.notes: Desert operations: dust storms most significant weather factor. TAF regularly indicates dust events reducing visibility. ILS/DME and GPS approaches essential during dust conditions. Heat impacts runway performance.

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: None - capable of large international aircraft (A380, B747 certified)

runway_details.notes: Primary runway - modern construction rated for heavy international traffic
Secondary runway - supports parallel operations and cargo flights

runway_specifications.notes: Designed for modern 4th generation aviation infrastructure. Both runways equipped for heavy aircraft. Parallel runway system allows flexible operations.

crew_requirements.minimum_pilot_hours: ICAO standard commercial requirements + desert operations awareness
crew_requirements.notes: Standard ICAO commercial pilot qualifications. CAT I ILS rating required for approaches in dust conditions. Desert operations experience valuable but not mandated. GCAA regulations apply.

handling_complexity.fuel_availability: Jet A and Jet A-1 24/7 - multiple suppliers
handling_complexity.immigration_processing_time_avg: 30-60 minutes depending on flight type and passenger count
handling_complexity.notes: Dnata, Lufthansa Technik and other major handlers available 24/7. UAE customs efficient with pre-coordination. Multiple fuel suppliers ensure availability. Modern cargo facilities.

congestion_metrics.atc_delays_frequency: Moderate during peak cargo periods (2200-0600 UTC)
congestion_metrics.notes: Expanding airport with relatively good capacity utilization. Cargo operations dominate off-peak hours. Passenger services growing post-expansion. Modern ATC systems support efficient flow.

permits_and_clearances.notes: Landing permit required for all international flights. 72-hour advance notice recommended. GCAA documentation includes AOC, noise certificate, and flight details. Non-scheduled operators require additional approvals.

noise_restrictions.preferred_departure_routes: Published departure procedures minimize populated area overflight
noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: Low - relatively isolated location in desert
noise_restrictions.notes: GCAA noise management focused on compliance verification. Chapter 2 aircraft phase-out enforced. Noise penalties for non-compliance documented in NOTAMs.

infrastructure_reliability.notes: Modern cargo hub designed for 24/7 operations with full redundancy. Fire category 9 maintained continuously. Equipment maintenance tracked systematically.

security_requirements.notes: UAE Security Protocol Level 3 enforced. Advanced passenger information systems reduce delays. Business aviation security streamlined with FBO coordination.

seasonal_factors.notes: Peak tourist and business season winter months when temperatures moderate (18-28째C). Summer extreme heat (40-50째C) reduces activity. Cargo focus drives year-round operations independent of passenger seasonality.

secondary_alternates: OMAA - Abu Dhabi International (140 km - 120 min)
alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Dubai International (OMDB) primary alternate but 45 minutes flight time. Sharjah (OMSJ) closer ground-wise but smaller. Abu Dhabi (OMAA) distant but major hub. OMDW expansion will reduce alternate requirements.

payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Advance payment on account or wire transfer
payment_and_fees.notes: Landing permit fees approximately AED 500-1500 depending on aircraft. Handling agent prepayment standard ($500-2000). Fuel available via Air BP, Shell at market rates. Payment via wire transfer typical for international operators.

operational_hours.notes: Daylight operations only: 0700-2200 LT (2300-1400 UTC). Night curfew enforced 2200-0700 LT except emergency/medevac. Non-training flights restricted during peak hours: 0930-1030, 1200-1300, 1500-1600, 1700-1800 LT.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: Currently no formal slot requirement but coordination recommended
slot_requirements.peak_congestion_times: Peak hours as noted in operational hours; Monsoon season increases congestion
slot_requirements.notes: No current slot control but anticipated future requirement as traffic increases. Advance booking 24+ hours recommended. Training flight restrictions support GA priority periods.

weather_vulnerability.wind_limitations: Monsoon winds can reach 25+ knots; standard crosswind operations
weather_vulnerability.seasonal_risk_periods: Southwest Monsoon: May-September; Northeast Monsoon: November-March; afternoon thunderstorms year-round common
weather_vulnerability.notes: Tropical rainforest climate with heavy rainfall particularly afternoons. Monsoon periods (May-Sept, Nov-Mar) bring frequent thunderstorms and reduced visibility. No instrument approaches available - visual circuits required.

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: Approximately 50,000 lbs MTOW typical maximum - light GA focus

runway_details.notes: Single runway in constrained airspace. Primary users: turboprops, corporate jets, light GA aircraft.

runway_specifications.notes: Single runway limits flexibility during weather diversions. Narrow runway width (46m) requires precision approaches. Valley-like airspace constraints limit turn diameters on approaches.

crew_requirements.notes: Visual flight rules only - no instrument approaches. Pilots must be familiar with complex restricted airspace (Sembawang Airbase, Paya Lebar). Specific approach procedures from feeder points mandatory (Jaybee NDB, Sinjon VOR, Kong Kong NDB). Operating in Fish Bowl airspace requires precision and situational awareness.

handling_complexity.fuel_availability: Avgas and Jet A available during operating hours (limited night availability)
handling_complexity.customs_hours: Limited - coordination required. Typically 0900-1700 LT weekdays
handling_complexity.notes: Universal Aviation provides IS-BAH Stage 1 services. Small facility compared to Changi. Ground handling less expensive than Changi but fewer options. Customs/immigration capacity limited - pre-coordination essential.

congestion_metrics.peak_hour_delays_typical: 20-45 minutes during restrictions and adverse weather
congestion_metrics.airspace_complexity: Very High - surrounded by restricted military airspace (Sembawang Airbase, Paya Lebar Airport), creating 'Fish Bowl' effect
congestion_metrics.atc_delays_frequency: Common during peak hours and restricted periods due to airspace constraints
congestion_metrics.notes: Severe airspace restrictions dominate operations more than runway capacity. Monsoon season compounds delays. Growing traffic at small facility. No parallel runway capability to support concurrent operations during peaks.

permits_and_clearances.landing_permit_processing_time: N/A - but CAAS flight plan filing required
permits_and_clearances.notes: Singapore domestic operations standard procedures apply. International flights subject to CAAS registration. No formal landing permit but proper flight plan and coordination mandatory due to restricted airspace. CAAS AIP compliance required.

noise_restrictions.chapter_requirements: Chapter 3 minimum for continuous GA operations
noise_restrictions.preferred_departure_routes: Specific noise abatement departure routes published
noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: High - residential areas nearby; strict enforcement
noise_restrictions.notes: Night curfew (2200-0700 LT) enforces noise restriction. Freighter operations banned 1400-2300 hours. Overflights of residential areas below 1,500ft prohibited. High-power engine run-ups restricted 1600-2200 UTC. Fines for violations documented.

infrastructure_reliability.historical_closure_incidents: None significant documented in operational history
infrastructure_reliability.notes: Well-maintained facility with redundant systems. Single runway constraint is primary operational risk factor rather than facility reliability. Infrastructure modernized with terminal expansion.

security_requirements.vip_security_delays: Minimal with pre-coordination at business aviation terminal
security_requirements.passenger_background_check_required: Singapore CAAS standard protocols - strict enforcement
security_requirements.notes: Singapore maintains strict aviation security due to geopolitical location. Business Aviation Centre (SBAC) operates at Universal Aviation with IS-BAH accreditation. Enhanced screening for international operations.

seasonal_factors.summer_thunderstorm_frequency: Very High - year-round afternoon convection; peak during monsoon
seasonal_factors.holiday_peak_dates: Chinese New Year, Hari Raya, Deepavali, Christmas holidays
seasonal_factors.notes: Tropical climate dominates operations. SW Monsoon (May-Sept) and NE Monsoon (Nov-Mar) periods drive weather patterns. Afternoon thunderstorms nearly daily during monsoon season. Tropical heat (avg 27째C) consistent year-round.

secondary_alternates: WSLP - Paya Lebar Air Base (3 km - but restricted military)
alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Changi International (WSSS) only practical alternate - 8 NM away. Suitable for all commercial aircraft. Ground transport via taxi approximately 20 minutes. Paya Lebar restricted military use. Diversions to Changi common during monsoon season weather.

payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Payment on delivery or account with FBO
payment_and_fees.notes: Landing charges: SGD 12.50-1,355 depending on aircraft MTOW. Parking: SGD 53+ per 24 hours (first 3 hours free). Passenger service fee: SGD 44; Aviation levy: SGD 8 (as of April 2025 - increases planned). Credit cards and wire transfer accepted.

compilation_metadata.research_period: Comprehensive web research across authoritative aviation sources
compilation_metadata.data_quality_notes: All 14 risk factor categories documented per airportdatarequirements.json specification. Cross-referenced across multiple official sources for accuracy verification.

research_sources_summary.KVNY: FAA, LAWA, AirNav, iFlyvny.com, Universal Weather, SKYbrary
research_sources_summary.OMDW: UAE GCAA, Dubai Airports Authority, AirNav, SKYbrary, Centre for Aviation, Universal Weather
research_sources_summary.WSSL: CAAS, Changi Airport Group, Universal Aviation Singapore, SKYbrary, Singapore AIP, OpsGroup

compilation_metadata.schema_compliance: All 14 risk factor categories present: operational_hours, slot_requirements, weather_vulnerability, runway_specifications, crew_requirements, handling_complexity, congestion_metrics, permits_and_clearances, noise_restrictions, infrastructure_reliability, security_requirements, seasonal_factors, alternate_airport_proximity, payment_and_fees
compilation_metadata.geographic_coverage: US West Coast (Van Nuys, California), Middle East (Dubai, UAE), Southeast Asia (Singapore)
compilation_metadata.notes: Van Nuys represents busiest general aviation airport globally. Dubai Al Maktoum represents high-capacity international hub in desert environment. Singapore Seletar represents constrained GA airport in tropical region with complex airspace. Data captures operational challenges specific to each geographic region.
